statements.name: PROC STDIZE
statements.description: The STDIZE procedure standardizes one or more numeric variables in a SAS data set by subtracting a location measure and dividing by a scale measure.

arguments.name: ADD=
arguments.description: Specifies a constant, c, to add to each value after standardizing and multiplying by the value you specify in the MULT= option. The default value is 0.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: Specifies the input data set to be standardized. If you omit the DATA= option, the most recently created data set is used.

arguments.name: FUZZ=
arguments.description: Specifies the relative fuzz factor. The default value is 1Eâ€“14.

arguments.name: INITIAL=
arguments.description: Specifies the method for computing initial estimates for the A estimates (ABW, AWAVE, and AHUBER).
arguments.help: INITIAL=MEAN | MEDIAN | SUM | EUCLEN | USTD | STD | RANGE | MIDRANGE | MAXABS | IQR | MAD | AGK | SPACING | L

arguments.name: KEEPLEN
arguments.description: Specifies that output variables inherit the length of the analysis variable that PROC STDIZE uses to derive them.

arguments.name: METHOD=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of the method for computing location and scale measures.
arguments.help: METHOD=MEAN | MEDIAN | SUM | EUCLEN | USTD | STD | RANGE | MIDRANGE | MAXABS | IQR | MAD | ABW | AHUBER | AWAVE | AGK | SPACING | L | IN

arguments.name: MISSING=
arguments.description: Specifies the method (or a numeric value) for replacing missing values. If you omit the MISSING= option, the REPLACE option replaces missing values with the location measure given by the METHOD= option.

arguments.name: MULT=
arguments.description: Specifies a constant, c, by which to multiply each value after standardizing. The default value is 1.

arguments.name: NMARKERS=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of markers used when you specify the one-pass algorithm (PCTLMTD=ONEPASS). The value n must be greater than or equal to 5. The default value is 105.

arguments.name: NOMISS
arguments.description: Omits observations with missing values for any of the analyzed variables from calculation of the location and scale measures.

arguments.name: NORM
arguments.description: Normalizes the scale estimator to be consistent for the standard deviation of a normal distribution when you specify the option METHOD=AGK, METHOD=IQR, METHOD=MAD, or METHOD=SPACING.

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of the SAS data set created by PROC STDIZE.

arguments.name: OUTSTAT=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of the SAS data set containing the location and scale measures and other computed statistics.

arguments.name: PCTLDEF=
arguments.description: Specifies which of five definitions is used to calculate percentiles when you specify the option PCTLMTD=ORD_STAT. By default, PCTLDEF=5.

arguments.name: PCTLMTD=
arguments.description: Specifies the method used to estimate percentiles.

arguments.name: ORD_STAT
arguments.description: Computes the percentiles by the order statistics method.

arguments.name: ONEPASS
arguments.description: Modifies the P-square algorithm for histograms nvented by Jain and Chlamtac (1985).

arguments.name: P2
arguments.description: P-square algorithm for histograms proposed by Jain and Chlamtac (1985).

arguments.name: PCTLPTS=
arguments.description: Writes percentiles to the OUTSTAT= data set. Values of n can be any decimal number between 0 and 100, inclusive.

arguments.name: PSTAT
arguments.description: Displays the location and scale measures.

arguments.name: REPLACE
arguments.description: Replaces missing data with the value 0 in the standardized data (this value corresponds to the location measure before standardizing).

arguments.name: REPONLY
arguments.description: Replaces missing data only; PROC STDIZE does not standardize the data.

arguments.name: SNORM
arguments.description: Normalizes the scale estimator to have an expectation of approximately 1 for a standard normal distribution when you specify the METHOD=SPACING option.

arguments.name: UNSTD
arguments.description: Unstandardizes variables when you specify the METHOD=IN(ds) option.

arguments.name: VARDEF=
arguments.description: Specifies the divisor to be used in the calculation of variances. By default, VARDEF=DF.

statements.name: BY
statements.description: Obtains separate analyses on observations in groups defined by the BY variables.

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: Specifies that the observations are sorted in descending order by the variable that immediately follows the word DESCENDING in the BY statement.

arguments.name: NOTSORTED
arguments.description: Specifies that observations are not necessarily sorted in alphabetic or numeric order.

statements.name: FREQ
statements.description: If one variable in the input data set represents the frequency of occurrence for other values in the observation, specify the variable name in a FREQ statement. PROC STDIZE treats the data set as if each observation appeared n times, where n is the value of the FREQ variable for the observation.

statements.name: LOCATION
statements.description: The LOCATION statement specifies a list of numeric variables that contain location measures in the input data set specified by the METHOD=IN option.

statements.name: SCALE
statements.description: The SCALE statement specifies the list of numeric variables containing scale measures in the input data set specified by the METHOD=IN option.

statements.name: VAR
statements.description: The VAR statement lists numeric variables to be standardized. If you omit the VAR statement, all numeric variables not listed in the BY, FREQ, and WEIGHT statements are used.

statements.name: WEIGHT
statements.description: The WEIGHT statement specifies a numeric variable in the input data set with values that are used to weight each observation. Only one variable can be specified.
